alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN WARREN AND CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 AM EDT... At 1030 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Kings Island, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Mason, Lebanon, Wilmington, Blanchester, New Vienna, Morrow, Kings Island, South Lebanon, Maineville, Clarksville, Martinsville, Midland, Butlerville, Melvin, Murdock, State Route 123 at State Route 132, Fort Ancient, Landen, Lees Creek and Morrisville. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 22 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
